data.title: Oppenheimer Sweeps the Globes, Wins Picture, Director, Actor, Score – Awardsdaily
data.text:
FILM

BEST DRAMA

“Oppenheimer”

BEST COMEDY OR MUSICAL

“Poor Things”

BEST DIRECTOR

Christopher Nolan, “Oppenheimer”

BEST ACTOR, DRAMA

Cillian Murphy, “Oppenheimer”

BEST ACTRESS, DRAMA

Lily Gladstone, “Killers of the Flower Moon”

BEST ACTOR, COMEDY OR MUSICAL

Paul Giamatti, “The Holdovers”

BEST ACTRESS, COMEDY OR MUSICAL

Emma Stone, “Poor Things”

BEST SUPPORTING ACTOR

Robert Downey Jr., “Oppenheimer”

BEST SUPPORTING ACTRESS

Da’Vine Joy Randolph, “The Holdovers”

BEST ANIMATED FILM

“The Boy and the Heron”

BEST NON-ENGLISH LANGUAGE FILM

“Anatomy of a Fall”

BEST SCREENPLAY

Justine Triet and Arthur Harari, “Anatomy of a Fall”

BEST ORIGINAL SCORE

Ludwig Göransson, “Oppenheimer”

BEST ORIGINAL SONG

“What Was I Made For?,” “Barbie

CINEMATIC AND BOX OFFICE ACHIEVEMENT

“Barbie”

TELEVISION

BEST DRAMA SERIES

“Succession”

BEST COMEDY/MUSICAL SERIES

“The Bear”

BEST ACTOR, DRAMA

Kieran Culkin, “Succession

BEST ACTRESS, DRAMA

Sarah Snook, “Succession”

BEST ACTOR, COMEDY/MUSICAL

Jeremy Allen White, “The Bear”

BEST ACTRESS, COMEDY/MUSICAL

Ayo Edebiri, “The Bear”

BEST SUPPORTING ACTOR

Matthew Macfadyen, “Succession”

BEST SUPPORTING ACTRESS

Elizabeth Debicki, “The Crown”

BEST LIMITED SERIES

“Beef”

BEST PERFORMANCE BY A MALE ACTOR, LIMITED SERIES

Steven Yeun, “Beef”

BEST PERFORMANCE BY A FEMALE ACTOR, LIMITED SERIES

Ali Wong, “Beef”

BEST PERFORMANCE IN STAND-UP COMEDY ON TELEVISION

Ricky Gervais: Armageddon
